content.description: Climb up through a few huecoes while making a difficult clip at the 4th bolt.  After the tough clip make a dynamic toss off some crimps to a ledge.  crux is traversing right into the last bolt and moving past it.
content.location: forth route from the right side of the wall

content.description: Rightmost route on the wall.  Mostly climbing on sandy edges till the top where you get a couple huecoes.  Carefull for loose/crumbling holds.
content.location: right most route on the wall

content.description: start climbing through huecoes into a left leaning corner.  Pull over the small bulge onto the face above on crimps which is the crux.  continue to the anchors a few feet away.
content.location: third route from the right side of the wall

content.description: bouldery start on smooth rock with 2 bolts right off the ground.  the rock steepens and climb becomes easier on big huecos.  crux for me was hold finding at the top.
content.location: second route from the right side of the wall

content.description: Start just left of Sandblaster. Traverse ledges through some chossy rock, then make fun, long moves between good holds to reach a hueco. Figure out how to reach the holds above, then battle through the lip of the roof to the anchors.
content.location: Right side of the wall, just left of Sandblaster.Â
right of generations, left of sand boxing

content.description: Some big moves through steep huecos lead to a burly crux section at the angle change. Pull onto the headwall with difficulty and continue up a few more bolts to another brief angle change before the chains. Bouldery.
content.location: Left side of the crag. This is currently the 4th line of bolts from the left, starting in a steep section with lots of huecos.

content.description: Climbs a huge scoop into the wall above.
content.location: Right of a partially bolted line. 2 routes left of rubber bullet

content.description: Climbs the wall just left of a black streak, past a couple of obvious pockets.
content.location: right of rubber bullet, left of crimson crimp

content.description:
This is an old project, #7 in the Handren book. Begins with some big moves between good, albeit sandy ledges (crag theme). A few really cool dimples, and a gym like left hand jug lead you to the first crux. Move straight right with a right knee smear on some right facing edges. From this stance work your left hand onto a heinous sloper above the lip and pounce up and right to a big flat ledge. Finish out the bullet slab.  

  A really fun, punchy little route. I filled in a drilled 2 finger pocket next to the sloper in the crux.  

  The rock quality after the first bolt or so is bomber. A worthwhile route along with several of the other rigs at this secluded shady crag.
Big scoops lead to thin, sustained wall climbing
content.location: Start 20' to the right of Rubber Biscuit at the right end of the wall, just to the right of the black streak on the right.

content.description: (From the Handren guide book): this crag sits low on the right side of the gully that slants up to the east underr the Great Red Book.  It is a very shady wall that almost never gets any sun.  There is some Fragile and sandy rock here, but also a few good routes.
